intro: Corylopsis yui, commonly known as the Japanese candleberry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has narrow, glossy leaves that turn yellow in the fall. Corylopsis yui prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique flowering period makes it a valuable addition to gardens in colder climates.
